review.title: Tableaux for Dynamic Logic of Propositional Assignments
review.abstract: The Dynamic Logic for Propositional Assignments (DL-PA) has recently been studied as an alternative to Propositional Dynamic Logic (PDL). In DL-PA, the abstract atomic programs of PDL are replaced by assignments of propositional variables to truth values. This makes DL-PA enjoy some interesting meta-logical properties that PDL does not, such as eliminability of the Kleene star, compactness and interpolation. We define and analytic tableaux calculus for DL-PA and show that it matches the known complexity results.

sections.heading: 7 Discussion and Conclusion
sections.text: In this thesis, we have defined a linear reduction in satisfaction, which flows into the testing of the model in DL-PA. We also define analytical tableaux methods for verifying formulas in the starless fragment and in the complete DL-PA. The complexity of these methods corresponds to the complexity class of their respective problems. Subsequently, we compare these methods with similar approaches and discuss possible improvements and extensions. The methods presented in this thesis were inspired by other methods already proposed in the literature. For example, De Giacomo and Massacci [3] (see also [12]) inspired the technique for the Kleene star. As already mentioned, the naive strategy would create tableau branches with exponential size in the input formula. The idea of remembering the tree and conducting equality tests stems from this work.
